quote: If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor. If an elephant has its foot on the tail of a mouse and you say that you are neutral, the mouse will not appreciate your neutrality.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

quote: We are not makers of history. We are made by history.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Those who do not remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

quote: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: History is a set of lies agreed upon.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Following the light of the sun, we left the Old World.
author: Christopher Columbus

quote: People are trapped in history and history is trapped in them.
author: James Baldwin

quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: History is not a burden on the memory but an illumination of the soul.
author: John Dalberg-Acton

quote: History, despite its wrenching pain, cannot be unlived, but if faced with courage, need not be lived again.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons of history.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much it is whether we provide enough for those who have little.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: I came, I saw, I conquered.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: There are no extraordinary men... just extraordinary circumstances that ordinary men are forced to deal with.
author: William Halsey

quote: Never, never and never again shall it be that this beautiful land will again experience the oppression of one by another.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A small body of determined spirits fired by an unquenchable faith in their mission can alter the course of history.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The past actually happened but history is only what someone wrote down.
author: A. Whitney Brown

quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
author: George Washington

quote: God cannot alter the past, though historians can.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition, a voyage and not a harbor.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: If one morning I walked on top of the water across the Potomac River, the headline that afternoon would read: 'President Can't Swim.'
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: History develops, art stands still.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: History is a gallery of pictures in which there are few originals and many copies.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: I do not think it is an exaggeration to say history is largely a history of inflation, usually inflations engineered by governments for the gain of governments.
author: Friedrich August von Hayek

quote: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present. The occasion is piled high with difficulty, and we must rise with the occasion. As our case is new, so we must think anew and act anew.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Most of the things worth doing in the world had been declared impossible before they were done.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: Peace, plenty, and contentment reign throughout our borders, and our beloved country presents a sublime moral spectacle to the world.
author: James K. Polk

quote: Time is my greatest enemy.
author: Evita Peron

quote: History is indeed little more than the register of the crimes, follies, and misfortunes of mankind.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: It takes an endless amount of history to make even a little tradition.
author: Henry James

quote: The very ink with which history is written is merely fluid prejudice.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I cannot lead you into battle. I do not give you laws or administer justice but I can do something else - I can give my heart and my devotion to these old islands and to all the peoples of our brotherhood of nations.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

quote: The past is malleable and flexible, changing as our recollection interprets and re-explains what has happened.
author: Peter L. Berger

quote: Be as a tower firmly set; Shakes not its top for any blast that blows.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Difficulty is the excuse history never accepts.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: History never looks like history when you are living through it.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: I come into the peace of wild things who do not tax their lives with forethought of grief... For a time I rest in the grace of the world, and am free.
author: Wendell Berry

quote: Never doubt that you can change history. You already have.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Pearl Harbor caused our Nation to wholeheartedly commit to winning World War II, changing the course of our Nation's history and the world's future.
author: Joe Baca

quote: History is a cyclic poem written by time upon the memories of man.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: The whole course of human history may depend on a change of heart in one solitary and even humble individual - for it is in the solitary mind and soul of the individual that the battle between good and evil is waged and ultimately won or lost.
author: M. Scott Peck

quote: Posterity! You will never know how much it cost the present generation to preserve your freedom! I hope you will make a good use of it.
author: John Adams

quote: A truly American sentiment recognizes the dignity of labor and the fact that honor lies in honest toil.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Get up tomorrow early in the morning, and earlier than you did today, and do the best that you can. Always stay near me, for tomorrow I will have much to do and more than I ever had, and tomorrow blood will leave my body above the breast.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: History is an account, mostly false, of events, mostly unimportant, which are brought about by rulers, mostly knaves, and soldiers, mostly fools.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Perhaps in time the so-called Dark Ages will be thought of as including our own.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: History is the sum total of things that could have been avoided.
author: Konrad Adenauer

quote: Americans love to fight. All real Americans love the sting of battle.
author: George S. Patton

quote: The construction of Europe is an art. It is the art of the possible.
author: Jacques Chirac

quote: I have tried to lift France out of the mud. But she will return to her errors and vomitings. I cannot prevent the French from being French.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: I did not come to NASA to make history.
author: Sally Ride

quote: In the long term we can hope that religion will change the nature of man and reduce conflict. But history is not encouraging in this respect. The bloodiest wars in history have been religious wars.
author: Richard M. Nixon

quote: 90 percent of my time is spent on 10 percent of the world.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Legend: A lie that has attained the dignity of age.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The fall of the Berlin Wall makes for nice pictures. But it all started in the shipyards.
author: Lech Walesa

quote: They died hard, those savage men - like wounded wolves at bay. They were filthy, and they were lousy, and they stunk. And I loved them.
author: Douglas MacArthur
